ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a class about contemporary issues in foreign policy. If you're interested in discussing these issues, it's a good class to take. I would warn students, though, that it does not go in much depth at all in the issues, so if you're looking for a course that really considers the issues in depth this might not be the best one to take. That said, Negroponte is a great person to get to know and has interesting insight into American foreign policy.
yes.i especially loved the discussion on Israel and Palestine, and Climate Change when Amb. Negroponte revealed his diplomatic expertise and how he would address the challenges.
This was a really interesting course that allowed us to survey the major issues of our time in an interesting and meaningful way.
I would recommend this course to a student interested in foreign policy.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I would summarize this course as saying that a student will be able to learn a ton about the pressing national security issues facing the US from all over the world from a very experienced and insightful professor.
INRL 765 was a great survey course of current international issues related to US national security. Would definitely recommend this course to others.
Valuable survey course on the issues with someone who very often has first hand insight.
This is a useful overview of U.S. foreign policy from an experienced policy practitioner. I would recommend this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It provided a useful survey of major issues facing the US today.
It definitely helped me place the issues that I had been researching within the broader framework of international affairs and national security.
It helped me think about conflicts in the South China Sea. I benefited from Amb. Negroponte's insights on a number of issues.

This course gave me a lot of insightinto different regions of the world and their interactions/importance with US foreign policy. I also learned a lot about the historical context of US foreign policy relations with many countries and heard a lot of great anecdotes from the professor's personal experiences.
Course definitely helped prepare me for future career in international affairs.
It gave me a fuller understanding of contemporary issues, which can be difficult to get in an academic environment.
